_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



The Golden Rod Broilers, Inc. Cullman, Alabama plant is a poultry processing facility.  The facility was originally built in the 1970's and through expansions has increased its refrigeration process to where it has more than 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  Golden Rod has implemented a Process Safety Management program to comply with OSHA regulations and the Risk Management Plan in compliance with the EPA.



Golden Rod Senior Management Commitment



Golden Rod is committed to safety and allocates resources to accomplish safety goals, for example:



Purchasing safety equipment; hiring a consultant for assistance with safety and environmental matters, having full time managers on staff that have safety & environmental responsibility, conducting safety training for managers, supervisors and employees, training, equipping and maintaining emergency preparedness including a HAZWOPER team.



Golden Rod Ammonia Refrigeration Department



The refrigeration system is operated by a trained full time refrigeration staff that includes 4 Refrigeration Technicians and 2 Refrigeration Supervisors.  The system is regularly monitored, inspected and maintained.  The refrigeration department utilizes preventative maintenance, standard operating procedures, regular and frequent inspections and safety programs.  



Safety procedures include: lockout tagout, hot work permit, hazard communication, ammonia safety, respiratory protection, contractor control, opening system permits, hearing protection, fire prevention and protection, hazardous waste disposal, emergency response and maintenance procedures to ensure the safe operation of the refrigeration system.



The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps



The facility is covered under OSHA 29 CFR 1910.110 Process Safety Management and EPA 40 Part 68 Risk Management Plan for having more than 10,000 pounds of Anhydrous Ammonia.  The release prevention measures and

activities are detailed in the PSM program.  In addition, an ammonia refrigeration contractor is utilized to provide maintenance support, improvements and additional maintenance activities beyond the plantA?s capabilities as needed.



The Process Safety Management program for the facility is comprised of these sections:



- Introduction to Process Safety Management

- Refrigeration Theory, Terms and Definitions

- Anhydrous Ammonia Material Safety Data Sheet

- Employee Participation

- Process Safety Information 

- Training Guidelines

- Contractor Qualification Guidelines

- Trade Secrets

- Pre-Startup Safety Review

- Mechanical Integrity

- Ammonia System Entry

- Hot Work 

- Confined Space Entry

- Critical Safety Override

- Facility and Area Access

- Lockout / Tagout

- Management of Change

- Emergency Response

- Incident Investigations

- Compliance Audits

- System Overview

- Standard Operating Procedures

- P&ID Drawings

- ASME U-1AA?s

- Materials of Construction

- ManufacturerA?s Information

- Mechanical Integrity Data Sheets

- Ammonia Inventory Calculation

- Relief Valve Calculation

- Ventilation Calculation

- PHA What-If Study Overview

- Process Hazard Analysis Guidelines

- Process Hazard Analysis Results

- Process Hazard Analysis Recommendations

- Risk Management Plan (EPA Filing)



The Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama PSM program has been designed to address the requirements of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Final Rule 1910.119, "Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals." 



Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama has designed and structured its PSM program to conform to current Safety and Health Policies, training programs, employee participation practices, vendor-supplied equipment operating and maintenance procedures, and current management policies and practices, and to eliminate excessive rework of existing safe practices.  The Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama Process Safety Management program is struc

tured to address future requirements also.



The PSM program includes existing procedures and practices whenever practical and appropriate.  The complete PSM program ensures comprehensive coverage of process areas handling anhydrous ammonia and application of process safety controls.



The concept of Process Safety Management has its roots in solid management practices developed in various process industries.  Management systems are a structured, systematic method to implement an identified set of activities with assigned responsibilities to achieve desired results.  The management systems combine into a PSM program providing organization and application of Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama government and industry controls, policies, practices, and procedures.



PSM Process and Facility Overview



Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama operates an ammonia refrigeration process comprised of 2 separate systems in close proximity to one another and under the same roof.  The ammonia process is used to produce space cooling, product cooling, and process equipment cooling.



The Golden Rod, Cullman, Alabama refrigeration system is designed to provide:



operating flexibility (through availability of multiple operating equipment combinations);

economy and efficiency of operations (through the use of operating pressures commensurate with the degree of cooling required and alternative fuel / energy equipment);

optimal safety performance (through minimal use of ammonia liquid pumps, utilizing instead the pressure differentials established in the system to move liquid refrigerant, detection systems, inspections and alarms); and



5 Year Accident History



The facility has had no accidental releases in the past five years.  



Emergency Response Program



The facility is an evacuation only facility and relies on outside responders  



Planned changes to improve safety include continuing regular plant employee safety training and safety audits.
